name: The Giggling Glade
description: You stand at the northwestern edge of a peculiarly cheerful forest. Buttercup-yellow flowers carpet the ground, their petals shimmering with an almost crystalline sheen. The air smells of honey and vanilla, with just the faintest undertone of copper. A painted wooden sign declares 'WELCOME FRIENDS!' in aggressively jovial letters. When you're not looking directly at it, you could swear the exclamation mark twitches. Birds sing overhead in perfect harmonyâ€”perhaps too perfect, as if they've rehearsed this exact melody ten thousand times. A family of rabbits watches you from beneath a bush. You count seven pairs of ears. Then eight. Then seven again.
